items.weapons

Interface Weapon

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Item
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWeapon, Dagger, Fist, ShortSword

    public interface Weapon
extends Item
    This interface starts the Weapon branch of classes, and contains the statements .getDmg() and .setDmg(). It implements the Item interface.
    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String attackString(int dmg, Entity user, Entity target)
      This method returns a String containing stylized information on how much the weapon is doing, representing the attack using the weapon.
      int getDmg()
      This method finds and returns the standalone damage value of the particular weapon.
      void setDmg(int newDmg)
      This method sets the standalone damage value of the weapon to a new value.

      • Methods inherited from interface items.Item

        equals, getName, setName, toString

    • Method Detail

      • getDmg

        int getDmg()
        This method finds and returns the standalone damage value of the particular weapon.
        Returns:
        The damage value of the weapon.

      • setDmg

        void setDmg(int newDmg)
        This method sets the standalone damage value of the weapon to a new value.
        Parameters:
        newDmg - the new damage value for the weapon.

      • attackString

        java.lang.String attackString(int dmg,
                              Entity user,
                              Entity target)
        This method returns a String containing stylized information on how much the weapon is doing, representing the attack using the weapon.
        Parameters:
        dmg - How much damage the user is doing with the weapon.
        user - The Entity that is using the weapon.
        target - The target Entity the weapon is being used on.
        Returns:
        A String containing stylized information on what the weapon is doing.
